719502f-a.folder: Houston Street (East) & Essex Street, Manhattan, NY

715838f-a.folder: Avenue A & Houston Street (East), Manhattan, NY

719699f-a.text:
178-184 Essex Street, adjoining, nd at the S.E. corner of Houston Street. The view also shows Avenue A, west side, north of Houston Street. Public School Number 13 is at the right.
July 17, 1929.
P.L. Sperr.
719699f-a.folder: Essex Street & Houston Street, Manhattan, NY

719499f-a.text:
(1)
East Houston Street, north side, vest from Ave. "A." Also shown is 1-3 Ave. "A" (5-story building at apex), west side, between East Houston and East 1st (extreme right) Streets. These houses were later demolished to make room for the construction of the Independent Subway System (Eighth Ave. Subway). IIn the foreground is shown the entrance to B. S.
No. 13.
December 21, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A portion of the same prior to the demolition shown in No. 1. This view is westward from No. 210, (shown on the extreme right), as seen from Ludlow Street. Note the Second Ave. Elevated Line on Allen Street.
July 17, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
A view northward through clearance shown in No. 1. Appearing across same are buildings on the north side of East 1st Street, between First Ave. (left, not shown) and Ave. A (right, not shown). This view
is as seen north from Ludlow Street.
December 21, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

732969f-a.title: Social conditions - Unemployed [unemployment market.]
732969f-a.text:
Social Conditions--Dnemployed: An unempolyaent market at Houston and Esser treets, Manhattan, where the unemployed hire thenselves out for od1 jobs.
MAY BE REPRODUCED  Early 1930's

719503f-a.text:
(1)
East Houston Street, south side, east from Essex Street, showing the block from Essex to Norfolk Streets, after the demolition of P.S. No. 13. Also shown (across clearance) are Nos. 190 to 184 Norfolk Street, at, adjoining and south of the S.E. corner of East Houston Street.
April 28, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, at a later date, as seen from Essex Street. (extreme foreground) and including a view of the west side of the street.
May 8, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

719501f-a.text:
225 to 217 East Houston Street, at and adjoining the S. W. corner of Easex Street, as seen across clearance on the west side of Avenue A, between East 1st and Houston Streets. Also shown (left) is No. 181 Essex Street, adjoining the Provident Loan Association Building, No's 223-225 East Houston, and i83 Essex Streets. The 7 story factory building shown on the right is
No. 181 Ludlow Street,,west side, south of Houston Street.
April 3, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

719697f-a.text:
Essex Street, south from East Houston Street. Note the Provident Loan Association Building on the right. Structures that formerly lined the east side of this thoroughfare have been demolished in the course of widening.
July 14, 1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Art Project.
